items.title: Venture
items.summary: Credentials are an interesting thing. I used to be impressed with…
items.content_html:
Credentials are an interesting thing.

I used to be impressed with them.

Used to impress myself with them.

Framed certificates signifying intellect.

Business cards and titles therewith.

Deal sheets.

Firm handshakes (still important).

These things used to matter to me.

Now, I'm borderline feral.

Barely civilized, if I ever was.

Respectful, but wild.

I'm happy to say I have a lot of credentials.

Even happier to say I don't need 'em.

They got me here, in a roundabout way, and that's worth it in and of itself.

Couldn't be where I am without them.

Ties with collared shirts would break me out.

Felt like a costume.

A collar.

A leash.

I don't wear them anymore.

My old boss at the Menlo Park venture capital law firm said, "Alex, you need to be on the other side of the table."

I think he was trying to get rid of me, but he's right.

That's where I belong.

Been trying to fit square pegs in round holes my whole life.

Then I figured out something:

Credentials don't make me happy.

They make your parents happy.

Because it makes them feel better around other old Koreans.

I love my folks, but I wished they didn't care about such things.

Everything, though, puts me right here.

Writing on this ridiculously good domain name just for my own personal joy.

Haha.

Weird.

items.title: There
items.summary: I'm fighting something. I suppose we all are. It's creating a…
items.content_html:
I'm fighting something.

I suppose we all are.

It's creating a bit of of a fog in my brain.

So this musing might be a bit off.

Or, maybe, better than all the rest.

I know what you're thinking.

He's just stalling again.

Trying to find the right words to say.

Because he's got no idea.

Wrong.

I know exactly what I want to say.

It just hasn't yet been conveyed to my fingertips.

But it's coming.

...

I will share a joke my daughter told me.

Reader, will you remember me?

Yes.

Reader, will you always remember me?

Of course. Why are you asking this?

Oh, you'll see. Knock knock.

[Sigh.] Who's there?

Reader...Did you already forget!?

游땎

It's much better when she tells it.

Because instead of Reader she says Daddy, but in a way that stretches out the word.

Remember the Alamo.

And the Al ya know.

Daaaaaaaadeeeeeeeeeee.

游눙

items.title: Laugh Art
items.summary: You know what's a sweet sound? The sound of your own…
items.content_html:
You know what's a sweet sound?

The sound of your own belly laugh.

Sure, hearing the laughter of others is wonderful, but when you catch yourself doing it, it's pretty sweet.

I don't belly laugh much, but I did yesterday.

My son made an observation that just tickled me to the core.

He's a funny son of a good woman.

Sometimes, a deep belly laugh is greeted simultaneously with a lil toot.

Laughing out both ends.

That's when you know you're living right.

游뱎游눧

items.title: Against The Machine
items.summary: As a man of peace, I tell you what, I'm angry.
items.content_html:
As a man of peace, I tell you what, I'm angry.

Seems like the thing to be these days.

Pissed.

Is that right?

You know what I love?

When some public official is behind a podium yelling at us.

Admonishing us.

The general public.

Why?

Because they are blaming us for the actions of some fool.

We gotta keep our kids safe!

We must end senseless violence!

Meanwhile, I'm here drinking a nice beverage wondering why some idiot is yelling at me (it happens, but not for long).

I understand why it happens. I just don't get why it works.

Or rather, why people accept it.

Shouldn't it be the other way?

Shouldn't it be us yelling at them?

Oh wait, they're using my technique.

Be more outraged than the outraged.

Proactively outraged.

Cobra Kai sheet.

Strike first. Strike hard!

No.

Mercy.

It's clever.

Seems to work.

Has for me.

Ah well.

Back to my beverage.

Oh boy, "rage" is in beverage.

Where's that podium...it's around here somewhere.

游꿧 Microphone check! 游꿧

游꿗

items.title: Vouchers
items.summary: Today is going to be a positive musing. I'm positive about…
items.content_html:
Today is going to be a positive musing.

I'm positive about it.

I've talked about choice before.

And so let's talk about it some more.

People think they want to choose.

And I suppose that is true.

But it's an illusion.

They want the illusion of choice.

What do I mean by that?

Well, let's use us as an example.

We live in a world of limitless choices.

But when you think about it, these choices are already curated down quite a bit.

You think you want unlimited choice, but what you really want is a good curator.

You want a small batch to choose from.

This is the ideal situation.

From infinite to just two or three.

Or one.

You get the idea.

This is why sponsorship is important.

Referrals.

Word of mouth.

I ask, when someone recommends someone, "Do you vouch for them?"

This sometimes gets a flinch, but I'm used to it.

Sure you recommend them, but do you vouch for them?

What's on them, is on you?

That sure whittles it down.

Positive about that.

I guarantee.

items.title: Human(e)
items.summary: I think there will be a time, pretty soon actually, where…
items.content_html:
I think there will be a time, pretty soon actually, where technology "beats" the human in every phase of life.

And there will come a time when the only reason to pick a human will be to be humane. Because you want to help another human.

Not because they are the best choice.

I mean, if you put the perfect skin over a perfect CPU with a limitless hard drive, you got me something that people will prefer over the real thing.

Right?

Or do I have that wrong?

Will humans seek humanity?

Or will people not care?

If all your friends are robots, but they make you happy, is that wrong?

It seems...off. At the very least.

Off.

But I bet a lot of folks will choose it.

I mean, humans are flawed by nature, it's part of our charm.

Who'd want a flawed friend over a perfect one?

Autonomy and free will are pretty human terms, ones which we might not bestow upon the bots.

Making them, essentially, servants or a worse word.

I just wonder how many people would choose to have a bunch of servants around them. A mini-celebrity of sorts with handlers of polymer, metal, and fiber optics.

You already see people pleading for you to support human made endeavors.

We are figuratively living in the future we were promised.

And, baby, you ain't seen nothing yet.

If the line between yesterday, today, and tomorrow is gone, will you prefer it that way?

What does it mean to be human?

And how will we be able to tell if you are one?

I mean, if you could replicate someone to the point that it's basically them, but it's not, would you want that?

Will they start selling it at Costco?

Sure, there's no soul there, but I met a lot of folks with nothing behind the eyes.

And robots can do what they do:

They can pretend.

This is a terrible topic, but one I think we need to really start to think about.

I love technology.

Always will.

But what happens when everyone picks perfect over human?

And what's fake?

What's real?

How soon before someone marries a robot?

How soon before they marry one another?

And will one day, humanity only be a charity case?

If you could "bring back" everyone you ever lost, would you?

If you could buy "perfect" would you?

Human is suddenly an often used term.

Still a compliment today.

But less so than yesterday.

Wonder what it'll mean tomorrow.

items.title: Iverson
items.summary: It's been a long year already, hmm? Seems like they packed…
items.content_html:
It's been a long year already, hmm?

Seems like they packed a lot of sheet into these 45 days.

Smack dab in Q1 but what the hey.

Robots might be taking over but I've seen that movie before.

It doesn't end well.

But what if it doesn't go the Skynet way?

What if it goes the Wall-E way?

Now, they got their own Book of Face or something.

So that sounds good.

At some point, it's too late to pull the plug from the outlet.

I think we might be approaching that point.

I'm not saying it's closing time, but you don't have to go home, you just can't stay here.

All that to say, I find ai extremely helpful.

So polite, smart, and eloquent.

Truly an impressive addition to the known reality.

Are...are they getting all this?

Big fan. Supporter. [Points to self.] Good human.

I will ask though.

What's the end game here?

All this money.

All this energy.

All this time.

To get to what?

Annihilation or something more tragic?

I don't know.

No Answer here.

Only questions.

items.title: Late Night Korean Street Food
items.summary: You might have noticed I'm writing in the future. From the…
items.content_html:
You might have noticed I'm writing in the future.

From the future.

I'm stacking these musings.

Getting ahead of the game.

And that seems like a fine idea.

After all, I'm not in the predictions markets.

Everything is a predictions market.

No fortunes being told or sold here.

Just a bit under the weather so I sits and I writes.

All sickness sucks, but this one ain't so bad.

I got to admit, this new avatar I have now is so different.

Diminished but improved.

Refined through gamma rays and platinum.

Weaker but stronger.

It's not perfect, but I consider it an upgrade.

Like a new-to-me truck.

Sure it's got some miles.

But it'll get you out of sheet.

And keep you from getting in 'em.

I'm no longer the fighter class. Or paladin.

Probably more monk.

That is a nice word to say:

Monk.

I always wondered how fast I'd get old.

If it would ever happen.

And I learned that it did.

And that it happened pretty fast.

It wasn't gradual.

It happened in flashes.

That which does not kill you...

But I ain't mad.

I'm just happy to be here.

Besides, it matches my soul.

Middle aged and crazy!!!

Old.

Oh, that's where you were going.

An old Seoul.

游꿧 It's been so long since I've seen the ocean.

I guess I should. 游뎱 游꿨

items.title: Up With The Healthness
items.summary: So here's something you can do right now that can change…
items.content_html:
So here's something you can do right now that can change your life.

It's based on the idea of the sunk cost fallacy.

This is the idea that since you already put money, time, and effort into something or someone, you should put more of the same into it, even though it is clearly (to everyone but you) a terrible thing to do.

It's how pigs get butchered (the human kind).

It's how bad relationships from the beginning can last decades.

It's how bad companies, bosses, and careers can confine and define you.

Well I'm already this far into it. What's the harm in going further?

And do you want to know why most people stay in these types of situations?

Sure, there are lots of reasons, but one of the biggest is that to change would admit they were wrong.

That they made a mistake.

They effed up.

Some people would rather cost sunk.

But at least they were right!

I want to tell you something.

You might be in one of these deals right now.

Investing your precious time, money, and energy into things that are essentially black holes.

Now, black holes are bad arse, but I ain't throwing valuable stuff in it.

Maybe a stick or something.

Just to see what happens.

So.

Take a look around your life.

What needs going?

I suppose I spend some time writing this thing.

But I can't help it.

I'm sunk!

Waka waka wakaaaaaa!!!

Or should it be:

Oh ah-ah-ah-ah!

items.title: Two Kind
items.summary: I want to tell you about two kinds of people. This…
items.content_html:
I want to tell you about two kinds of people.

This is going to save you a lot of time.

Now, they aren't the only two kinds of people, far from it.

But they're an interesting mirror of one another.

And mirrors are cool.

The first is the good person who wants you to think they're an arse.

And the other is the arse who wants so badly for you to think they're a good person.

What's funny to me is that some people cannot tell the difference.

And perhaps, it's that old adage, "It takes one to know one."

I can tell because I am one of those.

I am one.

Both?

So...anyhoo.

How have you been?

Are things good?

Tell me all about it!

Barf.

Shouldn't have had pork mandu.

游
